main event: An observation of a luminescent object emerging from a cloud in Victoria West, Cape Province, South Africa on February 29, 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared to resemble a huge drop of water,The sighting lasted for 51.5 seconds,It illuminated the countryside as it moved,The observer concluded it was not as bright as typical meteor objects,It was speculated that the object could be a balloon or aircraft, with insufficient data for a definitive conclusion.
location: Victoria West, Cape Province, South Africa
witness description: Gainer Deere, who observed the object in a rural setting
